content.description: Stand start the slab in the right side of the dihedral. Use the crack to pull onto the overhanging section and use a good right foothold to move up and pull onto the slab to the right. At this point you are on a 15 foot friction slab over a bad landing. Keep calm and smear to the lip of the boulder to topout. Those with zero head game can chicken out and transition left to the mellow slab to retreat. Topping out to the left is similar to pink pointing a trad route.
content.protection: Enough pads to make you mentally confident enough to commit. So... 2?
content.location: This line follows the right inside part of the beautiful and unique dihedral boulder. Yellow on the topo.

content.description: Sit start on the left arete of the dihedral on a crimp or two. Slab up the arete to the right until you reach a jug at the crack at the top of the dihedral. The first ascensionist topped out to the left by pulling onto the easy slab. Continuing right and finishing on No Second Chances gives you a rewarding, delicate, and thrilling finish to a classic thuggy problem.
content.protection: Probably 2 pads, but doable with one.
content.location: This line climbs up the left side of the awesome dihedral feature on the boulder. Purple on the topo.
